1.verse: Parashat Bamidbar Census of Fighting Men - In the wilderness of Sinai, on the first day of the second month in the second year from the Exodus from the land of Egypt, ADONAI spoke to Moses in the Tent of Meeting saying,

2.verse: “Do a head count of all the community of Bnei-Yisrael by their families and their ancestral house, with a total of every male one by one.

3.verse: You and Aaron are to muster by their divisions every son from 20 years and upward available to serve in the army of Israel.

4.verse: One man from each tribe, each head of his father’s household, is to assist you.

5.verse: “These then are the names of the men who will assist you: from Reuben, Elizur son of Shedeur.

6.verse: From Simeon, Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai.

7.verse: From Judah, Nahshon son of Amminadab.

8.verse: From Issachar, Nethanel son of Zuar.

9.verse: From Zebulon, Eliab son of Helon.

10.verse: From the sons of Joseph—from Ephraim, Elishama son of Ammihud, from Manasseh, Gamaliel son of Pedahzur.

11.verse: From Benjamin, Abidan son of Gideoni.

12.verse: From Dan, Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai.

13.verse: From Asher, Pagiel son of Ochran.

14.verse: From Gad, Eliasaph son of Deuel.

15.verse: From Naphtali, Ahira son of Enan.”

16.verse: These were those selected from the community, princes of their ancestral tribes. They were heads of the thousands of Israel.

17.verse: So Moses and Aaron took these men designated by name.

18.verse: They assembled all the community on the first day of the second month. They declared their lineage according to their families, the households of their forefathers, with the number of the names of those 20 years old and upward being listed individually.

19.verse: Moses numbered Israel in the wilderness of Sinai just as ADONAI had commanded him.

20.verse: The sons of Reuben, Israel’s firstborn (their generations, their families, by their ancestral households, according to the count of their names, every male from 20 years and upward, all available for the army),

21.verse: those counted from the tribe of Reuben were 46,500.

22.verse: From the sons of Simeon (their generations, according to their families, their ancestral households, whose names were counted by polls, every male 20 years and upward, every one who would go with the army),

23.verse: they counted from the tribe of Simeon 59,300.

24.verse: From the sons of Gad (their generations according to their families, to their ancestral households, in the count of names of every male 20 years old and upward, every one available to go out with the army),

25.verse: those counted from the tribe of Gad were 45,650.

26.verse: From the sons of Judah (their generations, by their families, their ancestral households, the count of their names, all who would go out with the army),

27.verse: those counted from the tribe of Judah were 74,600.

28.verse: From the sons of Issachar (their generations, according to their families, their ancestral households, by number of the names of every male 20 years old and upward, going out with the army),

29.verse: those counted from the tribe of Issachar were 54,400.

30.verse: From the sons of Zebulon (their generations, according to their families, to their ancestral households, by number of the names of everyone 20 years old and upward going out with the army),

31.verse: those counted from the tribe of Zebulun were 57,400.

32.verse: From the sons of Joseph—the sons of Ephraim (their generations according to their families, to their ancestral households, by count of the names of all those 20 years old and upward going out with the army),

33.verse: those numbered from the tribe of Ephraim were 40,500.

34.verse: From the sons of Manasseh (their generations according to their families, their ancestral households, by number of the names of those 20 years old and upward going out with the army),

35.verse: those counted from the tribe of Manasseh were 32,200.

36.verse: From the sons of Benjamin (their generations by their families, their ancestral households, by number of the names of every one 20 years old and upward going out with the army),

37.verse: those numbered from the tribe of Benjamin were 35,400.

38.verse: From the sons of Dan, their generations by their families their ancestral households, by number of everyone 20 years old and upward who would go out with the army,

39.verse: those numbered from the tribe of Dan were 62,700.

40.verse: From the sons of Asher (their generations by their families, their ancestral households, by number everyone 20 years old and upward who could go out with the army),

41.verse: those counted from the tribe of Asher were 41,500.

42.verse: From the sons of Naphtali (their generations by their families, their ancestral households, by number everyone 20 years old and upward who would go out with the army),

43.verse: those counted from the tribe of Naphtali were 53,400.

44.verse: These were the ones numbered—Moses, Aaron and the princes of Israel counted them. Each of the twelve men represented his ancestral house.

45.verse: So all those counted from Bnei-Yisrael, according to their ancestral houses, from 20 years old and up—all able to go out with the army in Israel—

46.verse: all those who were counted totaled 603,550.

47.verse: Duties of the Levities - The Levites, however, were not counted by the tribe of their ancestors,

49.verse: “Definitely you are not to number the tribe of Levi, nor take the sum of them among Bnei-Yisrael.

50.verse: Instead, you are to appoint the Levites over the Tabernacle of the Testimony, over all its implements and all pertaining to it. They are to carry the Tabernacle and all its utensils, tend to it and camp around it.

51.verse: Whenever the Tabernacle sets out, the Levites are to dismantle it, and whenever the Tabernacle is pitched, the Levites are to set it up. But the commoner who comes near to it must be put to death.

52.verse: Bnei-Yisrael will encamp, each man with his own camp, each with his own standard, according to their own divisions.

53.verse: The Levites are to camp around the Tabernacle of the Testimony, so that there will be no wrath unleashed on the community of Bnei-Yisrael. So the Levites are to maintain care of the Tabernacle of the Testimony.

54.verse: So Bnei-Yisrael did—all that ADONAI commanded Moses, so they did.

1.verse: Order of Ancestral Households - ADONAI said to Moses and Aaron saying, “

2.verse: Let each man encamp under his own standard among the banners of their ancestral house at an appropriate distance around the Tent of Meeting.

3.verse: Those camping on the east—toward the sunrise—will be of the standard of Judah, according to their divisions. Nachshon son of Amminadab, is the prince of the sons of Judah.

4.verse: His division, by their number, is 74,600.

5.verse: Camping next to him shall be the tribe of Issachar. The prince of the sons of Issachar is Nethanel son of Zuar.

6.verse: Their division, by their number, is 54,400.

7.verse: Next, the tribe of Zebulun. The prince of the sons of Zebulun is Eliab son of Helon.

8.verse: His division, by count, is 57,400.

9.verse: All those numbered to Judah’s camp, by their divisions, are 186,400. They are to advance first.

10.verse: The standard of the camp of Reuben shall be on the south side, by their divisions. The prince of the sons of Reuben is Elizur son of Shedeur.

11.verse: His division, by their number, is 46,500.

12.verse: Those camping next to them are the tribe of Simeon. The prince of the sons of Simeon is Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai.

13.verse: His division, by their number, is 59,300.

14.verse: Next, the tribe of Gad. The prince of the tribe of Gad is Eliasaph son of Reuel.

15.verse: His division, by their numbers, is 45,650.

16.verse: All those numbered to the camp of Reuben are 151,450. They are to set out second.

17.verse: Then the Tent of Meeting will move out with the camp of the Levites, which is in the middle of the camps—just as they were in camp, each person in his own place under his own appropriate standard.

18.verse: On the west will be the standard of the camp of Ephraim, by their divisions. The prince of the sons of Ephraim is Elishama son of Ammihud.

19.verse: His division, by their numbers, is 40,500.

20.verse: Next to him is the tribe of Manasseh. The prince of the sons of Manasseh is Gamaliel, son of Pedahzur.

21.verse: His division, by their numbers, is 32,200.

22.verse: Next, the tribe of Benjamin. The prince of the sons of Benjamin is Abidan son of Gideoni.

23.verse: His division, by their numbers, is 35,400.

24.verse: All those numbered to the camp of Ephraim are 108,100, by their divisions. They are to advance third.

25.verse: The standard of the camp of Dan shall be on the north, according to their divisions. The prince of the sons of Dan is Ahiezer, son of Ammishaddai.

26.verse: His division, by their numbers, is 62,700.

27.verse: Next to him will encamp the tribe of Asher. The prince of the sons of Asher is Pagiel, son of Ochran.

28.verse: His division, by their numbers, is 41,500.

29.verse: Next, tribe of Naphtali. The prince of the sons of Naphtali is Ahira son of Enan.

30.verse: His division, by their numbers, is 53,400.

31.verse: All those numbered to the camp of Dan are 157,600. They are to advance last by their standards.

32.verse: These are the numbers of Bnei-Yisrael, in accordance with their ancestral households. All those counted according to their divisions are 603,550.

33.verse: However, the Levites were not counted among Bnei-Yisrael, just as ADONAI commanded Moses.

34.verse: So Bnei-Yisrael acted in accordance with all that ADONAI had commanded Moses. Thus they camped by their standards and set out, each man according to their families and their ancestral houses.

1.verse: The Levite Families and Duties - These are the generations of Aaron and Moses current at the time ADONAI spoke to Moses at Mount Sinai.

2.verse: These are the names of Aaron’s sons: Nadab the first-born, Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.

3.verse: These are the names of the sons of Aaron, the anointed kohanim whom he consecrated to be priests.

4.verse: But Nadab and Abihu died before ADONAI for offering unauthorized fire before ADONAI in the Sinai wilderness—they had no children. So Eleazar and Ithamar served as kohanim under Aaron their father.

5.verse: Then ADONAI spoke to Moses saying,

6.verse: “Gather the tribe of Levi near, and appoint them to attend to Aaron the kohen.

7.verse: They are to keep watch over duties for him and the entire community before the Tent of Meeting while performing the service of the Tabernacle.

8.verse: They are to tend to all the implements of the Tent of Meeting and the service of Bnei-Yisrael while performing the service of the Tabernacle.

9.verse: You are to give the Levites to Aaron and his sons. Out of Bnei-Yisrael they are dedicated entirely to him.

10.verse: You are to appoint Aaron and his sons to maintain the priesthood; any commoner who approaches must be executed.”

11.verse: Then ADONAI said to Moses saying,

12.verse: “See, I have taken the Levites from among Bnei-Yisrael in place of the firstborn who open the womb among Bnei-Yisrael. The Levites will be Mine,

13.verse: because all the firstborn are Mine. In the day when I was striking down all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, I consecrated to Myself every firstborn in Israel—whether man or animal—as Mine. I am ADONAI.”

14.verse: ADONAI spoke in the Sinai wilderness to Moses saying,

15.verse: “Count the sons of Levi. According to their ancestral house, by their families, every male a month old and upward you are to number them.”

16.verse: So Moses numbered them in accordance with the word of ADONAI, just as he was commanded.

17.verse: These were the sons of Levi, by their names: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

18.verse: These then were the names of the sons of Gershon—Libni and Shimei.

19.verse: The sons of Kohath by their families were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.

20.verse: The sons of Merari, by their families, are Mahli and Mushi. These then were the families of the Levites by their ancestral households.

21.verse: To Gershon belonged the family of the Libnites and the family of the Shimeites. These were the families of the Gershonites.

22.verse: The number of every male one month old and upward who were counted was 7,500.

23.verse: The Gershonites were to camp behind the Tabernacle on the west.

24.verse: The prince of the ancestral house of the Gershonites was Eliasaph son of Lael.

25.verse: The duties of the sons of Gershon in the Tent of Meeting were the Tabernacle, the tent, its coverings, the curtain of the entrance of the Tent of Meeting,

26.verse: the curtains of the courtyard, the screen of the entrance of the courtyard around the Tabernacle and altar, its ropes and all related to its use.

27.verse: To Kohath belonged the family of the Amramites, the family of the Izharites, the Hebronites and the Uzzielites. These were the Kohathite families.

28.verse: The number of every male one month old and upward was 8,600. Their duties were caring for the Sanctuary.

29.verse: The Kohathite families were to camp along the side of the Tabernacle on the south.

30.verse: The prince of the ancestral household of the Kohathites was Elizaphan son of Uzziel.

31.verse: They were responsible for the Ark, the table, the menorah, the altars, and the implements of the Sanctuary used in service with them, the curtain and all involved with its use.

32.verse: The chief prince of the Levites was Eleazar son of Aaron the kohen appointed over those whose responsibility was the care of the Sanctuary.

33.verse: To Merari belonged the families of the Mahlites and the Mushites. These were the families of Merari.

34.verse: Their number by count of every male one month old and upward was 6,200.

35.verse: The prince of the household of the father of the Merarites was Zuriel son of Abihail. They were to camp on the north side of the Tabernacle.

36.verse: The sons of Merari were appointed over the care of the frames of the Tabernacle, its crossbars, posts, bases, and all equipment for its use,

37.verse: the posts of the surrounding courtyard, their bases, pegs and ropes.

38.verse: Those camping in front of the Tent of Meeting, on the east, toward the sunrise, were Moses, Aaron, and his sons. They were to care for the Sanctuary on behalf of Bnei-Yisrael. But anyone unauthorized who approached had to be executed.

39.verse: All the Levites counted by Moses and Aaron at the word of ADONAI, by their families, inclusive of every male one month old and upward, were 22,000.

40.verse: Redemption of the Firstborn - ADONAI said to Moses, “Count every firstborn male of Bnei-Yisrael from one month old and upward and make a list of their names.

41.verse: Set the Levites apart for me in place of all the firstborn of Bnei-Yisrael, and, all the livestock of the Levites in place of the firstborn of the livestock of Bnei-Yisrael. I am ADONAI.”

42.verse: So Moses counted all the firstborn of Bnei-Yisrael as ADONAI commanded him.

43.verse: The sum total of the firstborn males of Bnei-Yisrael, one month old and upward, listed by name, was 22,273.

44.verse: Again ADONAI spoke to Moses saying,

45.verse: “Take the Levites in place of all the firstborn of Bnei-Yisrael, and the livestock of the Levites in place of their livestock. The Levites will be Mine. I am ADONAI.

46.verse: To redeem the 273 firstborn of Bnei-Yisrael exceeding the number of the Levites,

47.verse: you are to collect five shekels for each, based on the shekel of the Sanctuary, which is 20 gerahs.

48.verse: Give the money for the redemption of the extra ones of the firstborn of them to Aaron and his sons.”

49.verse: Hence Moses collected the redemption money for those exceeding the number redeemed by the Levites.

50.verse: From the firstborn of Bnei-Yisrael he collected silver weighing 1,365 shekels, according to the Sanctuary shekel.

51.verse: Moses gave the redemption money to Aaron and his sons, just as ADONAI commanded him, in accordance with the mouth of ADONAI.

1.verse: Preparing the Sanctuary to Move - ADONAI spoke to Moses and to Aaron saying,

2.verse: “Take a census of the sons of Kohath from among the sons of Levi, by their families and by their ancestral households,

3.verse: everyone from 30 years of age to 50, all who come to serve doing the work in the Tent of Meeting.

4.verse: “This is the task of the sons of Kohath in the Tent of Meeting—the most holy things.

5.verse: Whenever the camp is about to move out, Aaron and his sons are to take down the shielding curtain and cover the Ark of the Testimony with it.

6.verse: Then they are to cover this with porpoise hide, then spread over it a cloth of solid blue. Then they are to put its poles in place.

7.verse: “Then over the table of the Presence they are to spread a solid blue cloth, then lay on it the plates, ladles, bowls, and jars for the drink offering. The bread that is continually there is to remain there.

8.verse: Over them they are to spread a solid scarlet cloth, cover it with a covering of porpoise hide, then install its poles.

9.verse: “Then they are to take a blue cloth and cover the menorah for light, along with its lamps, tongs, snuffers and oil jars that they use to tend to it.

10.verse: They then are to wrap it and all its accessories in a cover of porpoise hide and place it all on a carrying frame.

11.verse: “Over the golden altar they are to spread a blue cloth and cover that with a covering of porpoise hide, then put its poles in place.

12.verse: “They are to take all the utensils used for the service of the ministry of the Sanctuary, wrap them in a blue cloth, cover them with porpoise hide, and place them on a carrying frame.

13.verse: “They are to remove the ashes from the altar, then spread over it a purple cloth.

14.verse: They are to put onto it all the utensils with which they tend to the altar, among them the firepans, meat forks, shovels and sprinkling bowls. They are to spread over it a covering of porpoise hide and install its poles.

15.verse: “When Aaron and his sons have finished covering the Sanctuary and all its holy implements, and when the camp is ready to move out, after this the sons of Kohath may come to do the carrying. But they must not touch the holy items or they will die. These are the task of the sons of Kohath with regard to the Tent of Meeting.

16.verse: “Eleazar son of Aaron the kohen will have charge of the oil for the light, the fragrant incense, the regular grain offering and the anointing oil. He is to have charge of the Tabernacle and all that is in it, including its holy items and all its implements.”

17.verse: ADONAI spoke to Moses and Aaron saying,

18.verse: “You are not to let the families of the tribe of the Kohathites be cut off from among the Levites.

19.verse: Do this for them so that they may live and not die whenever they approach the most holy items—Aaron and his sons are to go into the Sanctuary and assign each man his job and his responsibility.

20.verse: But the Kohathites are not to go in to look at what is holy, not even momentarily, or they will die.”

21.verse: Parashat Naso - Again ADONAI spoke to Moses saying,

22.verse: “Take a census also of the sons of Gershon, by their ancestral households and by their families.

23.verse: Count all the males from 30 to 50 years of age, everyone coming to work in the service of the Tent of Meeting.

24.verse: This is the task of the Gershonite families in working and carrying burdens.

25.verse: They are to carry the curtains of the Tabernacle, the Tent of Meeting, its covering, the outer covering of porpoise hide, the curtains for the entrance for the Tent of Meeting,

26.verse: the curtains surrounding the courtyard and the altar, the curtain for the entrance, the ropes and all the equipment used in its operations. They are to do all that needs to be done with these things.

27.verse: The sons of the Gershonites are to do all their tasks, whether carrying or doing other work, according to the word of Aaron and his sons. You are to assign to them all that is their responsibility to carry.

28.verse: This is the duty of the families of the sons of the Gershonites regarding the Tent of Meeting. Their duty will be under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron the kohen.

29.verse: Next, count the sons of Merari, according to their families and their ancestral houses,

30.verse: sons 30 years old and upward to 50, everyone coming to work in the service of the Tent of Meeting.

31.verse: This is their task in the service of the Tent of Meeting: the frames of the Tabernacle, its crossbars, posts and bases,

32.verse: as well as the posts of the surrounding courtyard, plus their bases, tent pegs, ropes, and all their paraphernalia with everything related to their operation. Assign to them by name their duties and tasks.

33.verse: This is the service of the families of the sons of Merari as they work under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron the kohen.”

34.verse: So Moses, Aaron and the princes of the community counted the sons of the Kohathites according to their families and their ancestral households.

35.verse: All the men who came to do the service of the Tent of Meeting, from 30 to 50 years of age,

37.verse: This was the total of those in the families of the Kohathites, every one serving in the Tent of Meeting—Moses and Aaron counted them according to the mouth of ADONAI by Moses’s hand.

38.verse: The sons of Gershon were counted according to their families and their ancestral households.

39.verse: Males from 30 years old and upward to 50, all those coming into the work of the service of the Tent of Meeting,

40.verse: numbered according to their families and ancestral households 2,630.

41.verse: These were those counted from the families of the sons of Gershon, each serving in the Tent of Meeting—Moses and Aaron counted according to the mouth of ADONAI.

42.verse: Those were counted from the families and ancestral households of the sons of Merari,

43.verse: from 30 years of age upward to 50, who came to the work of the service of the Tent of Meeting.

44.verse: Numbered by their families, they were 3,200.

45.verse: These were those numbered from the families of the sons of Merari by Moses and Aaron in accordance with the mouth of ADONAI by Moses’s hand.

46.verse: Thus Moses, Aaron and the princes of Israel counted all the Levites by their families and by their ancestral houses.

47.verse: All the men from 30 to 50 years old who came to do the work of the service and of carrying the Tent of Meeting

49.verse: From the mouth of ADONAI by Moses’s hand, each man was assigned his work and his burden to carry. So they were counted, as ADONAI commanded Moses.

1.verse: Purity in the Camp - ADONAI spoke to Moses saying,

2.verse: “Command Bnei-Yisrael to send out from the camp everyone with tza’arat, who has some kind of discharge, or any contaminated by a dead body.

3.verse: Whether male or female, you are to send them outside the camp so as not to defile the camp where I am dwelling among them.”

4.verse: This Bnei-Yisrael did, sending them outside the camp. Just as ADONAI spoke to Moses, so Bnei-Yisrael did.

5.verse: ADONAI spoke to Moses saying,

6.verse: “Say to Bnei-Yisrael: Whenever a man or woman commits any sins against any person, thus breaking faith with ADONAI, that soul bears guilt.

7.verse: That person is to confess the sin he has committed, make full restitution for his wrong, add one fifth to it and give it to the one he wronged.

8.verse: But if that person has no close relative to whom to pay the restitution, the restitution belongs to ADONAI. It is to be given to the kohen along with the ram of atonement with which he is to make atonement for him.

9.verse: “Every contribution from all the sacred things that Bnei-Yisrael brings to the kohen will belong to him.

10.verse: Each one’s sacred holy gifts are his own, but whatever each man gives to the kohen belongs to that kohen.”

11.verse: Jealousy Ritual - ADONAI spoke to Moses saying,

12.verse: “Speak to Bnei-Yisrael and say to them: Suppose some man’s wife goes astray and is unfaithful to him,

13.verse: and another man has sexual relations with her, but it is hidden from her husband’s eyes and her impurity is not detected. Yet there was no witness against her and she was not caught in the act.

14.verse: Then a spirit of jealousy overcomes him and he is suspicious of his wife, when she is impure. Or a spirit of jealousy overcomes him and he suspects his wife, yet she is not impure.

15.verse: “Then he should take his wife to the kohen. He must also bring a tenth of an ephah of barley flour as an offering for her. He is not to pour oil or put incense on it, because it is an offering for jealousy, a reminder offering drawing attention to guiltiness.

16.verse: “The kohen is to bring her near and have her stand before ADONAI.

17.verse: Then the kohen is to take some holy water in a clay jar and take some dust from the floor of the Tabernacle and put it into the water.

18.verse: Then the kohen will have the woman stand before ADONAI, loosen the woman’s hair, put into her hands the reminder offering, the offering for jealousy, while in the kohen’s own hands are the bitter waters that bring a curse.

19.verse: Then the kohen will have her swear under oath, then say to the woman, ‘If no man other than your husband has slept with you, and if you have not gone astray into impurity from your husband, may this bitter water that brings a curse not harm you.

20.verse: If, however, you have gone astray from your husband and if you became impure and had sexual relations with a man other than your husband’—

21.verse: Then the kohen is to have the woman swear under this oath of a curse, and say to the woman—‘then let ADONAI cause you to be cursed and denounced among your people when ADONAI causes your thigh to rot and your belly to swell.

22.verse: “May this water which brings a curse enter your body and cause your belly to swell and your thigh to rot.’ “The woman is to say, ‘Amen, amen!’

23.verse: “Then the kohen is to write these curses on a scroll and wash them into the waters of bitterness.

24.verse: The kohen will then have the woman drink the bitter water bearing curses, so that the water of the curses of bitterness enters her.

25.verse: The kohen is to take the jealousy offering from the woman’s hand, wave the offering before ADONAI and bring it to the altar.

26.verse: The kohen is to take a handful of the grain offering and burn it up in smoke on the altar as a memorial offering. The kohen will then have the woman drink the water.

27.verse: “When she is made to drink the water that carries the curse, if she has defiled herself and been unfaithful to her husband, it will enter her and cause bitterness—her abdomen will swell and her thigh will waste away. She will be accursed among her people.

28.verse: If, however, the woman has not defiled herself and is clean, she will be free from guilt and be able to have children.

29.verse: “This is the Torah regarding jealousy, when a woman goes astray from her husband and defiles herself,

30.verse: or when a spirit of jealousy comes over a man and he jealously suspects his wife. The kohen is to have her stand before ADONAI and apply this entire Torah to her.

31.verse: The husband will be free of guilt, but that woman will bear her guilt.”

1.verse: Nazirite Vows - Again ADONAI spoke to Moses saying,

2.verse: “Speak to Bnei-Yisrael and say to them: Any man or woman who desires to vow a Nazirite vow to be separate for ADONAI,

3.verse: is to abstain from wine and any other fermented drink. He is not to drink any vinegar made from wine or any fermented drink, or any grape juice, or eat grapes or raisins.

4.verse: “All during his days as a Nazirite he is not to eat anything from the grapevine—even the seeds or skins.

5.verse: All the duration of his Nazirite vow, no razor is to come on his head until the time of his consecration to ADONAI is over. He is to be holy, and the hair of his head is to grow long.

6.verse: All the days of his separation to ADONAI, he is not to go near a dead body.

7.verse: Even if his father, mother, brother or sister should die, he is not to make himself unclean, because his consecration to God is on his head.

8.verse: All the days of his separation, he is to be consecrated to ADONAI.

9.verse: “Now if someone should die suddenly in his presence, thereby defiling his dedicated head, he is to shave his head on the day of his purification—the seventh day.

10.verse: Then on the eighth day, he is to bring two doves or two young pigeons to the kohen at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

11.verse: The kohen is to offer one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering. He is to make atonement for him because he sinned through the corpse. He must consecrate his head on the same day.

12.verse: He will be dedicated to ADONAI for the days of his Nazirite separation. He is to bring a year-old male lamb as a guilt offering. The previous days will not count because he was contaminated during his Nazirite separation.

13.verse: “Then this is the Torah of the Nazirite when his period of separation is over. He must be brought to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

14.verse: He is to present his offering to ADONAI: a year-old male lamb without flaw as a burnt offering, a year-old female lamb without flaw as a sin offering, a flawless ram as a fellowship offering,

15.verse: along with a basket of matzah cakes made of fine flour mixed with oil and matzah wafers spread with oil, along with their grain and drink offerings.

16.verse: “The kohen will offer these before ADONAI, and present his sin offering and burnt offering.

17.verse: Then he is to sacrifice the ram as a fellowship offering to ADONAI, along with the basket of matzot. The kohen will also present the grain and drink offerings.

18.verse: The Nazirite is then to shave the hair of his dedication at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and he is to take the hair of his dedication and put it into the fire of the fellowship offering sacrifice.

19.verse: The kohen is to take the boiled shoulder of the ram and one matzah cake and one matzah wafer from the basket, and he is to place them into the hands of the Nazirite after he has shaved the hair of his dedication.

20.verse: The kohen will wave them before ADONAI as a wave offering. They are holy, and belong to the kohen along with the breast that was waved and the thigh that was presented. Afterward, the Nazirite may drink wine.

21.verse: This is the Torah regarding the Nazirite who vows his offering to ADONAI with regard to his consecration, besides whatever else he can afford. He must fulfill the vow he has made, in accordance with the Torah of his consecration.’”

22.verse: Aaronic Benediction - Again ADONAI spoke to Moses saying,

23.verse: “Speak to Aaron and to his sons saying: Thus you are to bless Bnei-Yisrael, by saying to them:

24.verse: ‘ADONAI bless you and keep you!

25.verse: ADONAI make His face to shine on you and be gracious to you!

26.verse: ADONAI turn His face toward you and grant you shalom!’

27.verse: In this way they are to place My Name over Bnei-Yisrael, and so I will bless them.”

1.verse: Offerings of Tribal Princes - When Moses finished setting up the Tabernacle, he anointed and consecrated it and all its implements, the altar and all its utensils, and he anointed and consecrated them.

2.verse: Then the princes of Israel, heads of their ancestral houses—they were tribal princes in charge over those who were numbered—gave offerings.

3.verse: They brought as their gift before ADONAI six covered carts and twelve oxen. A cart came from every two princes and an ox from each one of them. They presented them before the Tabernacle.

4.verse: ADONAI spoke to Moses saying,

5.verse: “Accept these from them to use in the service of the Tent of Meeting. Give them to the Levites to use as each man’s work requires.”

6.verse: So Moses took the carts and the oxen and he gave them to the Levites.

7.verse: He gave two carts and four oxen to the sons of Gershon, as their work required,

8.verse: and four carts and eight oxen to the sons of Merari, as their work required, under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron the kohen.

9.verse: But to the sons of Kohath he did not give any because their responsibility was carrying the holy items on their shoulders.

10.verse: When the altar was anointed, the princes brought their dedication offerings and presented them before ADONAI.

11.verse: For ADONAI had said to Moses, “Each day one of the princes is to bring his offering for the altar’s dedication.”

12.verse: Bringing his offering on the first day was Nahshon son of Amminadab, from the tribe of Judah.

13.verse: His offering was one silver plate weighing 130 shekels, one silver basin weighing 70 shekels by the shekel of the Sanctuary, both of them filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering,

14.verse: one ladle of 10 shekels of gold filled with incense,

15.verse: one young bull from the herd, one ram, one male lamb a year old as a burnt offering,

16.verse: one male goat as a sin offering,

17.verse: and two oxen, five rams, five male goats and five male lambs one year old to be sacrificed as a fellowship offering. This was the offering of Nahshon son of Amminadab.

18.verse: On the second day, Nethanel son of Zuar, prince of Issachar, brought his offering.

19.verse: The offering he brought was one silver plate weighing 130 shekels, one silver basin weighing 70 shekels according to the shekel of the Sanctuary, both filled with fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering,

20.verse: one gold ladle of 10 shekels filled with incense,

21.verse: one young bull, one ram and one male lamb one year old for a burnt offering,

22.verse: one male goat for a sin offering,

23.verse: and two oxen, five rams, five male goats and five male lambs one year old to be sacrificed as a fellowship offering. This was the offering of Nethanel son of Zuar.

24.verse: On the third day was the prince of the sons of Zebulun, Eliab son of Helon.

25.verse: His offering was one silver plate weighing 130 shekels, one silver basin weighing 70 shekels, both according to the shekel of the Sanctuary, both filled with fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering,

26.verse: one ladle of 10 shekels of gold filled with incense,

27.verse: one young bull, one ram and one male lamb a year old for a burnt offering,

28.verse: one male goat for a sin offering,

29.verse: two oxen, five rams, five male goats and five male lambs a year old to be sacrificed as a fellowship offering. This was the offering of Eliab son of Helon.

30.verse: On the fourth day was the prince of the sons of Reuben, Elizur son of Shedeur.

31.verse: His offering was one silver plate weighing 130 shekels, one silver basin weighing 70 shekels according to the shekel of the Sanctuary, both filled with fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering,

32.verse: one ladle of 10 shekels of gold filled with incense,

33.verse: one young bull, one ram, one male lamb a year old for a burnt offering,

34.verse: one male goat for a sin offering,

35.verse: and two oxen, five rams, five male goats and five male lambs a year old to be sacrificed as a fellowship offering. This was the offering of Elizur son of Shedeur.

36.verse: On the fifth day was the prince of the sons of Simeon, Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai.

37.verse: His offering was one silver plate weighing 130 shekels, one silver basin weighing 70 shekels according to the shekel of the Sanctuary, both filled with fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering,

38.verse: one ladle of 10 shekels of gold filled with incense,

39.verse: one young bull, one ram, one male lamb a year old for a burnt offering,

40.verse: one male goat for a sin offering,

41.verse: and two oxen, five rams, five male goats and five male lambs a year old to be sacrificed as a fellowship offering. This was the offering of Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai.

42.verse: On the sixth day was the prince of the sons of Gad, Eliasaph son of Deuel.

43.verse: His offering was one silver plate weighing 130 shekels, one silver basin weighing 70 shekels according to the shekel of the Sanctuary, both filled with fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering,

44.verse: one ladle of 10 shekels of gold filled with incense,

45.verse: one young bull, one ram and one male lamb a year old for a burnt offering,

46.verse: one male goat for a sin offering,

47.verse: and two oxen, five rams, five male goats and five male lambs a year old to be sacrificed as a fellowship offering. This was the offering of Eliasaph son of Deuel.

48.verse: On the seventh day was the prince of the sons of Ephraim, Elishama son of Ammihud.

49.verse: His offering was one silver plate weighing 130 shekels, one silver basin weighing 70 shekels according to the shekel of the Sanctuary, both filled with fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering,

50.verse: one ladle of 10 shekels of gold filled with incense,

51.verse: one young bull, one ram, one male lamb a year old for a burnt offering,

52.verse: one male goat for a sin offering,

53.verse: and two oxen, five rams, five male goats and five male lambs a year old to be sacrificed as a fellowship offering. This was the offering of Elishama son of Ammihud.

54.verse: On the eighth day was the prince of the sons of Manasseh, Gamaliel son of Pedahzur.

55.verse: His offering was one silver plate weighing 130 shekels, one silver basin weighing 70 shekels according to the shekel of the Sanctuary, both filled with fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering,

56.verse: one ladle of 10 shekels of gold filled with incense,

57.verse: one young bull, one ram, one male lamb a year old for a burnt offering,

58.verse: one male goat for a sin offering,

59.verse: and two oxen, five rams, five male goats and five male lambs a year old to be sacrificed as a fellowship offering. This was the offering of Gamaliel son of Pedahzur.

60.verse: On the ninth day was the prince of the sons of Benjamin, Abidan son of Gideoni.

61.verse: His offering was one silver plate weighing 130 shekels, one silver basin weighing 70 shekels according to the shekel of the Sanctuary, both filled with fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering,

62.verse: one ladle of 10 shekels of gold filled with incense,

63.verse: one young bull, one ram and one male lamb a year old for a burnt offering,

64.verse: one male goat for a sin offering,

65.verse: and two oxen, five rams, five male goats and five male lambs a year old to be sacrificed as a fellowship offering. This was the offering of Abidan son of Gideoni.

66.verse: On the tenth day came the prince of the sons of Dan, Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai.

67.verse: His offering was one silver plate weighing 130 shekels, one silver basin weighing 70 shekels according to the shekel of the Sanctuary, both filled with fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering,

68.verse: one ladle of 10 shekels of gold filled with incense,

69.verse: one young bull, one ram, one male lamb a year old as a burnt offering,

70.verse: one male goat for a sin offering,

71.verse: and two oxen, five rams, five male goats and five male lambs a year old to be sacrificed as a fellowship offering. This was the offering of Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai.

72.verse: On the eleventh day came the prince of the sons of Asher, Pagiel son of Ochran.

73.verse: His offering was one silver plate weighing 130 shekels, one silver basin weighing 70 shekels according to the shekel of the Sanctuary, both filled with fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering,

74.verse: one ladle of 10 shekels of gold filled with incense,

75.verse: one young bull, one ram, one male lamb a year old as a burnt offering,

76.verse: one male goat for a sin offering,

77.verse: and two oxen, five rams, five male goats and five male lambs a year old to be sacrificed as a fellowship offering. This was the offering of Pagiel son of Ochran.

78.verse: On the twelfth day came the prince of the sons of Naphtali, Ahira son of Enan.

79.verse: His offering was one silver plate weighing 130 shekels, one silver basin weighing 70 shekels, according to the shekel of the Sanctuary, both filled with fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering,

80.verse: one ladle of 10 shekels of gold, filled with incense,

81.verse: one young bull, one ram, one male lamb a year old for a burnt offering,

82.verse: one male goat for a sin offering,

83.verse: and two young bulls, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old to be sacrificed as a fellowship offering. This was the offering of Ahira son of Enan.

84.verse: This was the dedication offering from the princes of Israel for the day when the altar was to be anointed: twelve silver plates, twelve silver basins, twelve gold ladles.

85.verse: Each silver plate was of 130 shekels, and each silver basin was of 70 shekels. Altogether, the silver utensils weighed 2,400 shekels according to the shekel of the Sanctuary.

86.verse: The ten gold ladles filled with incense each weighed 10 shekels, by the shekel of the Sanctuary. Altogether, the gold ladles totaled 120 shekels.

87.verse: The total of the livestock for the burnt offering was twelve young bulls, twelve rams, and twelve male lambs a year old, along with their grain offering. Twelve male goats were sin offerings.

88.verse: The total number of livestock used for sacrifice of fellowship offerings was 24 oxen, 60 rams, 60 male goats and 60 male lambs a year old. These were the dedicatory offerings for the altar after it was anointed.

89.verse: When Moses entered the Tent of Meeting to speak with ADONAI, he heard the voice speaking to him from above the atonement cover atop the Ark of Testimony between the cheruvim. So he spoke with Him.

1.verse: Parashat Beha’alotecha Dedication of the Levites - ADONAI spoke to Moses saying,

2.verse: “Speak to Aaron and say to him: When you erect the lamps, the seven lamps are to illuminate the area in front of the menorah.”

3.verse: Aaron did so. He erected the lamps facing forward so they illuminated the area in front of the menorah, just as ADONAI had commanded Moses.

4.verse: Now this is how the menorah was made: hammered gold from its base to its blossoms. Just as was the pattern that ADONAI had shown to Moses, so he made the menorah.

5.verse: Again ADONAI spoke to Moses saying,

6.verse: “Take the Levites from among Bnei-Yisrael and ceremonially cleanse them.

7.verse: This is what you must do to them to make them clean: Sprinkle the purifying water on them, then have them shave their whole bodies and wash their clothes, thus purifying themselves.

8.verse: “Then they are to take a young bull with its grain offering of fine flour mixed with oil, plus a second young bull for a sin offering.

9.verse: Bring the Levites before the Tent of Meeting, and gather the whole community of Bnei-Yisrael.

10.verse: Bring the Levites before ADONAI, Bnei-Yisrael will lay their hands on the Levites,

11.verse: and Aaron will present the Levites before ADONAI as a wave offering from Bnei-Yisrael. Then they may go about the work of the service of ADONAI.

12.verse: “The Levites are to lay their hands on the heads of the bulls. Use one for a sin offering and the other for a burnt offering to ADONAI to make atonement for the Levites.

13.verse: Have the Levites stand before Aaron and his sons and present them as a wave offering to Adonai.

14.verse: In this way you are to set apart the Levites from Bnei-Yisrael to be Mine.

15.verse: After you have purified them and presented them as a wave offering, the Levites will come to do their work at the Tent of Meeting.

16.verse: For they are the ones from among Bnei-Yisrael given to Me in place of all the first from the wombs of Bnei-Yisrael. I have taken them for Myself.

17.verse: “For every firstborn among Bnei-Yisrael is Mine, whether human or animal. On the day I struck down the firstborn of the land of Egypt, I sanctified them for Myself.

18.verse: So I am taking the Levites in place of the firstborn of Bnei-Yisrael,

19.verse: and I am giving the Levites as a gift to Aaron and his sons from among Bnei-Yisrael, to do the work on behalf of Bnei-Yisrael in the Tent of Meeting, and to make atonement for them—so that there would be no plague among them for coming too close to the Sanctuary.”

20.verse: So Moses, Aaron and the entire community of Bnei-Yisrael did so with the Levites. All that ADONAI had commanded Moses regarding the Levites, so Bnei-Yisrael did to them.

21.verse: The Levites also purified themselves from sin and washed their clothes. Aaron presented them as a wave offering before ADONAI, and, he made atonement for them to purify them.

22.verse: After that, the Levites came to do their tasks before Aaron and his sons in the Tent of Meeting, just as ADONAI had commanded Moses concerning the Levites.

23.verse: ADONAI again spoke to Moses saying,

24.verse: “This is for the Levites. Men 25 years old and upward are to present themselves for service to work in the Tent of Meeting.

25.verse: But at the age of 50 he is to retire from his service and work no longer.

26.verse: He may assist his brothers in the Tent of Meeting to do their duties, but he himself will no longer do the work. Thus, you are to assign to the Levites their responsibilities.”

1.verse: Second Month Passover - ADONAI spoke to Moses in the Sinai wilderness in the first month of the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt saying,

2.verse: “Bnei-Yisrael is to observe Passover at its appointed time.

3.verse: You are to celebrate it at its appointed time, at twilight on the fourteenth day of this month, with all its rules and regulations.”

4.verse: So Moses told Bnei-Yisrael to observe Passover.

5.verse: They celebrated Passover at twilight on the fourteenth day of the first month in the Sinai wilderness. In accordance with all that ADONAI commanded Moses, so Bnei-Yisrael did.

6.verse: However, there were some men who could not celebrate Passover because of being defiled by a dead body. So they came to Moses and Aaron on that same day,

7.verse: and these men said to him, “We have become unclean because of a dead man’s body. Why should we be kept from presenting the offering of ADONAI at the appointed time with the rest of Bnei-Yisrael?”

8.verse: Moses answered them, “Wait, and I will inquire what ADONAI commands concerning you.”

9.verse: Then ADONAI spoke to Moses saying,

10.verse: “Say to Bnei-Yisrael saying: If any man, whether you or your descendants, becomes unclean because of a dead body, or is away on a long journey, he may yet observe ADONAI’s Passover.

11.verse: They are to celebrate it at twilight on the fourteenth day of the second month. With matzot and bitter herbs they are to eat it.

12.verse: They are not to leave any of it until morning, or break any bones. When they celebrate Passover they are to observe all its regulations.

13.verse: “But the person who is clean and not away on a journey, yet neglects to celebrate Passover, that soul shall be cut off from his people because that person did not present ADONAI’s offering at the appointed time. That man will bear his sin.

14.verse: “If an outsider living among you would celebrate Passover to ADONAI according to the requirement, so he should do. There will be for you the same regulation for the outsider and the native of the land.’”

15.verse: The Cloud as the Guide - On the day the Tabernacle was erected, the cloud covered the Tabernacle. By evening until morning, the cloud above the Tent of Testimony had an appearance like fire.

16.verse: It was that way continually. The cloud covered it, and by night it appeared like fire.

17.verse: Whenever the cloud lifted up from above the Tent, then Bnei-Yisrael would set out, and at the place where the cloud settled, there Bnei-Yisrael would encamp.

18.verse: At the mouth of ADONAI, Bnei-Yisrael would set out, and at the mouth of ADONAI they would encamp. All the days that the cloud remained over the Tabernacle, they would remain in camp.

19.verse: When the cloud would remain over the Tabernacle many days, Bnei-Yisrael would obey the command of ADONAI and not set out.

20.verse: At times the cloud stayed over the Tabernacle only a few days. At ADONAI’s word they would encamp, and at ADONAI’s word they would set out.

21.verse: At times the cloud remained only from evening until morning. When the cloud would lift, they would set out. Whether by day or by night, when the cloud lifted, they would set out.

22.verse: Whether for two days or a month or a year, while the cloud remained over the Tabernacle, Bnei-Yisrael remained camped and would not set out. But when it would lift, they would set out.

23.verse: At ADONAI’s word they would encamp, and at the mouth of ADONAI they set out. They obeyed ADONAI’s order by Moses’s hand.

1.verse: Silver Trumpets for Assembly - ADONAI spoke to Moses saying,

2.verse: “Make two trumpets of hammered silver for yourself. They are for summoning the community and having the camps set out.

3.verse: Whenever both are sounded, the whole community is to gather toward you at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

4.verse: But if only one is sounded, the princes—the heads of the tribes of Israel—are to gather toward you.

5.verse: When you sound the trumpet the first time, the camp of those camped on the east is to set out.

6.verse: When you sound the trumpet blast the second time, the camp of those camped on the south is to set out. Short blasts will be the signal for their moving out.

7.verse: To gather the whole national community, you are to sound the sustained blasts, but not the short blasts.

8.verse: The sons of Aaron will blow the trumpets. This is to be an eternal ordinance for you as well as for your generations to come.

9.verse: Whenever you go to war in your own land against the enemy who is hostile to you, you are to sound short blasts of alarm. Then you will be remembered before ADONAI your God and be delivered from your enemies.

10.verse: Also at your days of rejoicing, feasts and new moons, you are to blow on the trumpets over your burnt offerings and fellowship offerings. They will then be a reminder for you before ADONAI your God. I am ADONAI your God!”

11.verse: Journey From Sinai - On the twentieth day of the second month of the second year, the cloud lifted up from above the Tabernacle of the Testimony.

12.verse: Then Bnei-Yisrael set out on their travels in the Sinai wilderness. The cloud came to rest in the wilderness of Paran.

13.verse: So they set out the first time by the mouth of ADONAI by Moses’s hand.

14.verse: The standard of the camp of the sons of Judah set out first by their divisions. Over them was Nahshon son of Amminadab.

15.verse: Over the division of the tribe of the sons of Issachar was Nethanel son of Zuar.

16.verse: Over the division of the tribe of the sons of Zebulun was Eliab son of Helon.

17.verse: Then the Tabernacle was disassembled, and the sons of Gershon and Merari, who were carrying it, set out.

18.verse: The standard of the camp of Reuben then set out, by their divisions. Over his division was Elizur son of Shedeur.

19.verse: Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai, was over the division of the tribe of the sons of Simeon.

20.verse: Over the division of the tribe of the sons of Gad was Eliasaph son of Deuel.

21.verse: Then the Kohathites set out, carrying the holy items. The Tabernacle was to be erected before their arrival.

22.verse: The standard of the camp of the sons of Ephraim set out next, by their divisions. Over his division was Elishama son of Ammihud.

23.verse: Over the division of the tribe of the sons of Manasseh was Gamaliel son of Pedahzur.

24.verse: Over the division of the tribe of the sons of Benjamin was Abidan son of Gideoni.

25.verse: The standard of the camp of the tribe of the sons of Dan, being the rear guard of all the camps, set out by their divisions. Over his division was Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai.

26.verse: Pagiel son of Ochran, was over the division of the tribe of the sons of Asher.

27.verse: Ahira son of Enan, was over the division of the tribe of the sons of Naphtali.

28.verse: This is the order by which Bnei-Yisrael, by their divisions, set out.

29.verse: Moses said to Hobab son of Reuel the Midianite, Moses’ father-in-law, “We are setting out to the place about which ADONAI said, ‘I will give it to you.’ Come with us and we will do good to you, because ADONAI has spoken goodness to Israel.”

30.verse: But he said to him, “I will not go, because I would rather go to my own country and to my own people.”

31.verse: But he said, “Do not leave us now, because you know where we should camp in the wilderness. You can be like eyes to us.

32.verse: If you come with us, we will share with you whatever good ADONAI gives to us.”

33.verse: So they advanced from the mountain of ADONAI, a trip of three days, the Ark of the covenant of ADONAI going ahead of them for those three days to seek out a resting place for them.

34.verse: The cloud of ADONAI was over them by day when they advanced from the camp.

35.verse: Whenever the Ark would set out, Moses would say: “Arise, ADONAI! May Your enemies be scattered! May those who hate You flee from before You!”

36.verse: Then whenever it came to rest, he would say: “Return, ADONAI, to the myriad thousands of Israel!”

1.verse: 70 Elders to Share the Burden - The people were murmuring in the ears of ADONAI about hardship, and when ADONAI heard, His anger burned. The fire of ADONAI blazed among them, ravaging the outskirts of the camp.

2.verse: The people cried out to Moses, so Moses prayed to ADONAI and the fire died out.

3.verse: The name of that place was thus called Taberah because fire from ADONAI had burned among them.

4.verse: The grumblers among them began to have cravings, so Bnei-Yisrael began to wail repeatedly, saying, “If we could just eat some meat!

5.verse: We remember the fish that we used to eat in Egypt, for free—the cucumbers, the melons, the leeks, the onions, and the garlic!

6.verse: But now we have no appetite. We never see anything but this manna.”

7.verse: Now the manna was similar to coriander seed and had an appearance like gum resin.

8.verse: The people went about, gathered it up, and ground it in a hand mill or crushed it in a mortar. They cooked it in a pot or made it into cakes. It had a taste like something made with olive oil.

9.verse: When the dew descended on the camp at night, the manna descended with it.

10.verse: Moses heard the people wailing by their families, each man at the door to his tent. ADONAI’s anger became very hot, and Moses was troubled.

11.verse: So Moses asked ADONAI, “Why have You brought trouble on Your servant? Haven’t I found favor in Your eyes—that You laid the burden of all these people on me?

12.verse: Did I conceive all these people, or did I give birth to them, that You should say to me, ‘Carry them in your bosom just as the nurse carries an infant’—to the land You promised to their fathers?

13.verse: Where can I get meat for all these people? For they wail to me saying, ‘Give us meat to eat!’

14.verse: I am not able to carry all these people by myself! The load is too heavy for me!

15.verse: If this is how You are treating me, kill me now! If I have found favor in Your eyes, kill me please—don’t let me see my own misery!”

16.verse: ADONAI said to Moses, “Bring me 70 of the elders of Israel whom you know to be elders of the people and their leaders. Take them to the Tent of Meeting, so they may stand with you there.

17.verse: Then I will come down and speak with you there, and, I will take some of the Ruach that is on you and will place it on them. They will carry with you the burden of the people, so you will not be carrying it alone.”

18.verse: “Now to the people say: Sanctify yourselves for tomorrow, because you will eat meat, for you wailed in ADONAI’s ears saying, ‘If only we could eat meat! It was better for us in Egypt!’ Now ADONAI will give you meat and you will eat!

19.verse: You will eat—not for one day, or two days, or five days, or ten days, or twenty days,

20.verse: but for an entire month—until it is coming out of your nostrils and it becomes loathsome to you! For you rejected ADONAI who is among you, and you wailed to His face saying, ‘Why did we ever leave Egypt?”

21.verse: Moses then said, “600,000 foot soldiers—the people I am in the middle of—yet You say, ‘I am going to give them meat to eat for an entire month?’

22.verse: If flocks and herds were slaughtered, would they have enough? Or if all the fish in the sea were caught, would they have enough?”

23.verse: ADONAI said to Moses, “Is ADONAI’s arm too short? Now you will see whether My word will come true for you or not.”

24.verse: Seventy Elders Prophesying - So Moses went out and told the people ADONAI’s words. He gathered 70 of the elders of the people and had them stand around the Tent.

25.verse: ADONAI descended in the cloud and spoke with him. He took some of the Ruach that was on him and placed it on each of the 70 elders. It so happened that when the Ruach first rested on them, they prophesied—but never again.

26.verse: Two men, however, had remained in the camp. The name of one was Eldad and the name of the other was Medad. The Ruach rested on them. They were among those listed, but they had not gone out to the Tent. So they prophesied in the camp.

27.verse: A young man ran and told Moses and said, “Eldad and Medad are prophesying in the camp!”

28.verse: Joshua son of Nun, the assistant of Moses since his youth, cried out and said, “Moses, my lord, stop them!”

29.verse: But Moses said to him, “Are you jealous on my behalf? If only ADONAI would make all the people prophets! If only ADONAI would put the Spirit on all of them!”

30.verse: Then Moses and the elders of Israel returned to the camp.

31.verse: Quails From the Sea - Now a wind went out from ADONAI and drove quails from the sea. He brought them into the camp to about a day’s journey in any direction, about two cubits above the ground all around the camp.

32.verse: The people went out all that night and all the following day and collected quail. No one gathered less than ten omers. They spread them out all around the camp.

33.verse: Yet while the meat was between their teeth, before it was swallowed, ADONAI’s anger burned against the people. So ADONAI struck the people with a severe plague.

34.verse: For that reason the name of that place was called Kibroth-hattaavah, because they buried the people who were craving.

35.verse: From Kibroth-hattaavah the people journeyed to Hazeroth and stayed in Hazeroth.

1.verse: Miriam and Aaron Speak Against Moses - Then Miriam and Aaron spoke against Moses on account of the Cushite woman he married, because he had married a Cushite woman.

2.verse: They asked, “Has ADONAI spoken only through Moses? Hasn’t He also spoken through us?” ADONAI heard it.

3.verse: Now the man Moses was very humble, more so than anyone on the face of the earth.

4.verse: Immediately, ADONAI said to Moses, Aaron and Miriam, “The three of you, come out to the Tent of Meeting.” So the three came out.

5.verse: ADONAI descended in a column of cloud, stood at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and called to Aaron and Miriam. The two of them stepped forward.

6.verse: “Hear now My words!” He said. “When there is a prophet of ADONAI, I reveal Myself in a vision, I speak to him in a dream.

7.verse: Not so with My servant Moses. In all My house, he is faithful.

8.verse: I speak with him face to face, plainly and not in riddles. He even looks at the form of ADONAI! Why then were you not afraid to speak against My servant Moses?”

9.verse: ADONAI’s anger burned against them, and He left them.

10.verse: When the cloud lifted up from above the Tent, behold, Miriam had tza’arat, like snow! As Aaron turned toward her, behold, she had tza’arat!

11.verse: He said to Moses, “Please, my lord, don’t hold against us the sin we have committed so foolishly!

12.verse: Don’t let her be like a stillborn baby, who comes from his mother’s womb with his flesh half-eaten away!”

13.verse: So Moses cried to ADONAI saying, “O God, heal her now!”

14.verse: ADONAI said to Moses, “If her father had but spit in her face, would she not be in shame for seven days? Let her be confined outside the camp for seven days. After that she may be brought back.”

15.verse: So Miriam was restricted to outside the camp for seven days. The people did not move on until Miriam was brought back.

16.verse: Afterward, the people left Hazeroth and encamped in the Wilderness of Paran.

1.verse: Parashat Shlach Twelve Scouts and the Bad Report - ADONAI spoke to Moses saying,

2.verse: “Send some men on your behalf to investigate the land of Canaan, which I am giving to Bnei-Yisrael. Each man you are to send will be a prince of the tribe of his fathers, a man from each tribe.”

3.verse: So according to the word of ADONAI, Moses sent them from the wilderness of Paran. All the men were princes of Bnei-Yisrael.

4.verse: These are their names: from the tribe of Reuben, Shammua son of Zaccur.

5.verse: From the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat son of Hori.

6.verse: From the tribe of Judah, Caleb son of Jephunneh.

7.verse: From the tribe of Issachar, Igal son of Joseph.

8.verse: From the tribe of Ephraim, Hoshea son of Nun.

9.verse: From the tribe of Benjamin, Palti son of Raphu.

10.verse: From the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel son of Sodi.

11.verse: From the tribe of Manasseh, part of the tribe of Joseph, Gaddi son of Susi.

12.verse: From the tribe of Dan, Ammiel son of Gemalli.

13.verse: From the tribe of Asher, Sethur son of Michael.

14.verse: From the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi son of Vophsi.

15.verse: From the tribe of Gad, Geuel son of Machi.

16.verse: These are the names of the men Moses sent to investigate the land. (Now he gave Hoshea son of Nun, the name Joshua.)

17.verse: As he sent them to explore the land of Canaan, he said to them, “Go up there through the Negev, then go up into the hill country.

18.verse: See what the land is like and the people living there, whether they might be strong or weak, few or many.

19.verse: In what kind of land are they living? Is it good or bad? Also, what about the cities in which they are living? Are they unwalled or do they have fortifications?

20.verse: How is the soil—fertile or poor? Are there trees on it or not? Do your best to bring back some of the fruit of the land.” (It was the season for the first ripe grapes.)

21.verse: So they went up and explored the land from the wilderness of Zin as far as Rehob the entrance of Hamath.

22.verse: They continued on up through the Negev and came to Hebron. There lived Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai, descendants of Anak. (Hebron was built seven years before Zoan in Egypt.)

23.verse: When they reached as far as the Valley of Eshcol, they cut a single branch with a cluster of grapes. It was carried on a pole between two of them. They also cut some pomegranates and some figs.

24.verse: That place was called the Valley of Eshcol because of the cluster cut by Bnei-Yisrael.

25.verse: They returned from investigating the land after 40 days.

26.verse: They traveled and returned to Moses, Aaron and the entire community of Bnei-Yisrael at Kadesh in the wilderness of Paran. They gave their report to them and the entire assembly. They showed the land’s fruit.

27.verse: They gave their account to him and said, “We went into the land where you sent us. Indeed it is flowing with milk and honey—this is some of its fruit.

28.verse: Except, the people living in the land are powerful, and the cities are fortified and very large. We even saw the sons of Anak there!

29.verse: Amalek is living in the land of the Negev, the Hittites, Jebusites, and Amorites are living in the mountains, and the Canaanites are living near the sea and along the bank of the Jordan.”

30.verse: Then Caleb quieted the people before Moses, and said, “We should definitely go up and capture the land, for we can certainly do it!”

31.verse: But the men who had gone up with him said, “We cannot attack these people, because they are stronger than we.”

32.verse: They spread among Bnei-Yisrael a bad report about the land they had explored, saying, “The land through which we passed to explore devours its residents. All the people we saw there are men of great size!

33.verse: We also saw there the Nephilim. (The sons of Anak are from the Nephilim.) We seemed like grasshoppers in our eyes as well as theirs!”

1.verse: Grumblers Will Not Enter the Land - All through that night, the entire community raised up their voices. The people wept.

2.verse: All Bnei-Yisrael grumbled against Moses and Aaron and the whole community said, “If only we had died in Egypt! If only we had died in this wilderness!

3.verse: Why is ADONAI bringing us to this land to fall by the sword? Our wives and children will be like plunder! Wouldn’t it be better for us to return to Egypt?”

4.verse: They said to each other, “Let’s choose a leader and let’s go back to Egypt!”

5.verse: Then Moses and Aaron fell on their faces before the entire assembly of the community of Bnei-Yisrael.

6.verse: Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh, who were among those who had explored the land, tore their clothes.

7.verse: They said to the whole assembly of Bnei-Yisrael, “The land through which we passed is an exceptionally good land!

8.verse: If ADONAI is pleased with us, He will lead us into that land and will give it to us—a land flowing with milk and honey.

9.verse: Only don’t rebel against ADONAI, and don’t be afraid of the people of the land. They will be food for us. The protection over them is gone. ADONAI is with us! Do not fear them.”

10.verse: But the whole assembly talked about violently stoning them. Then the glory of ADONAI appeared at the Tent of Meeting to all Bnei-Yisrael.

11.verse: ADONAI said to Moses, “How long will these people treat Me contemptibly? How long will they neglect to trust in Me—in spite of all the miraculous signs I have performed among them?

12.verse: I will strike them with the plague. I will destroy them. But you I will make into a nation greater and stronger than they!”

13.verse: Moses said to ADONAI, “The Egyptians will hear about it, because You brought up this people by Your power from among them.

14.verse: They will tell the residents of this land about it. Already they have heard that You, ADONAI, are in the midst of this people, that You, ADONAI, have been seen eye to eye, that Your cloud remains over them, and that in a pillar of cloud by day and a pillar of fire by night You go before them.

15.verse: If you kill these people all at once, the nations who have heard this report about You will say,

16.verse: ‘Because ADONAI was unable to bring this people to the land He had promised them, He has slaughtered them in the wilderness.’

17.verse: “So please, let ADONAI show His strength, just as You have spoken saying,

18.verse: ‘ADONAI is slow to anger and abundant in lovingkindness, forgiving iniquity and transgression. Still, He does not leave the guilty unpunished, bringing the iniquity of the fathers upon the children to the third and fourth generations.’

19.verse: Forgive now the guiltiness of this people in accordance with the greatness of Your lovingkindness, just as You have pardoned this people from Egypt until now!”

20.verse: ADONAI answered, “I have forgiven them just as you have spoken.

21.verse: But as certainly as I live and as certainly as the glory of ADONAI fills the entire earth,

22.verse: none of the people who saw My glory and My miraculous signs I performed in Egypt and in the wilderness—yet tested Me these ten times and did not obey My Voice—

23.verse: not one of them will see the land I promised to their forefathers. None of those who treated Me with contempt will see it!

24.verse: However, My servant Caleb, because a different spirit is with him and he is wholeheartedly behind Me, I will bring him into the land where he went—his offspring will inherit it.

25.verse: Now since the Amalekites and Canaanites are inhabiting the valley, turn back tomorrow and set out by the wilderness route toward the Sea of Reeds.”

26.verse: ADONAI then said to Moses and Aaron saying,

27.verse: “How long will this wicked community be grumbling against Me? I have heard the complaints of Bnei-Yisrael grumbling against Me.

28.verse: So tell them, ‘As surely as I live,’ says ADONAI, ‘I will do to you just as I heard you say in My ears.

29.verse: In this very wilderness your bodies will drop—every one of you 20 years of age and older who was numbered in the census and grumbled against Me.

30.verse: Not one of you will enter the land about which I lifted My hand to make home for you—except Caleb son of Jephunneh and Joshua son of Nun.

31.verse: “As for your children—whom you said would be like plunder—I will bring them in and they will experience the land that you spurned.

32.verse: But your bodies will drop in this wilderness.

33.verse: Your children will be herdsmen in the wilderness for 40 years. They will suffer because of your unfaithfulness until your corpses are consumed in the wilderness.

34.verse: For 40 years, corresponding to the number of the 40 days you explored the land—one year for each day—you will suffer for your iniquities and know My hostility.

35.verse: I, ADONAI, have spoken and certainly will I do this to all this wicked community banding together against Me. In this wilderness they will meet their end and there they will die!”

36.verse: Then the men whom Moses had sent to explore the land, who had returned and caused the whole community to grumble against him by spreading a bad report about the land,

37.verse: these men, spreading the bad report about the land, died of the plague in ADONAI’s presence.

38.verse: Of those men who had gone to explore the land, only Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh survived.

39.verse: When Moses related these things to all of Bnei-Yisrael, the people mourned bitterly.

40.verse: They rose the next morning and went up to the high mountains, saying, “Look! Let’s go up to the place which ADONAI promised. For we have sinned.”

41.verse: But Moses said, “Why are you disobeying the mouth of ADONAI? That will never succeed.

42.verse: You should not go up, because ADONAI will not be among you and you will be defeated before your enemies!

43.verse: For the Amalekites and Canaanites are there in front of you, and you will fall by the sword. ADONAI will not be with you, because you turned away from following ADONAI.”

44.verse: But presumptuously they went up to the high mountain country, though neither the Ark of ADONAI’s covenant nor Moses moved from within the camp.

45.verse: The Amalekites and Canaanites living in the mountain country came down, attacked them, and beat them down all the way to Hormah.

1.verse: Fragrant Aromas to ADONAI - Again ADONAI spoke to Moses saying,

2.verse: “Speak to Bnei-Yisrael and say to them: When you enter the land that I am giving you where you will make your homes,

3.verse: and you are presenting a fire offering to ADONAI—a burnt offering or a sacrifice to mark fulfilling a vow, a freewill offering, or during moadim—to present a pleasing aroma to ADONAI, from the herd or from the flock,

4.verse: the one bringing the offering is to present a grain offering of a tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with a fourth of a hin of oil.

5.verse: “Now with each lamb for the burnt offering or sacrifice, you are to prepare a fourth of a hin of wine as a drink offering.

6.verse: With a ram, you are to prepare two tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with a third of a hin of oil,

7.verse: and a third of a hin of wine as a drink offering. You are to offer it as a pleasing aroma to ADONAI.

8.verse: “Whenever you are to prepare a young bull for a burnt offering, a special vow offering, or a fellowship offering to ADONAI,

9.verse: bring with the young bull a grain offering of three tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with half a hin of oil.

10.verse: You are to also offer as the drink offering half a hin of wine as a fire offering, a pleasing aroma to ADONAI.

11.verse: This is to be done for each bull or ram, for each young goat or lamb.

12.verse: Do this for each one, for as many as you prepare.

13.verse: “Everyone native-born is to do these things like so when bringing a fire offering as a pleasant aroma to ADONAI.

14.verse: Whenever an outsider resides with you, or whoever is among you for your generations to come, and he is to present a fire offering as a fragrant aroma to ADONAI, as you do, he must do exactly the same as you are doing.

15.verse: “The community will have the same rule for you as well as for the resident outsider. It will be a lasting statute throughout your generations. As for you, so for the outsider will it be before ADONAI.

16.verse: The same Torah and the same regulations will apply to both you and the outsider residing among you.”

17.verse: ADONAI spoke to Moses saying,

18.verse: “Speak to Bnei-Yisrael. Say to them: When you enter the land to which I am taking you,

19.verse: and you eat some of the food of the land, you are to offer a portion to ADONAI.

20.verse: You are to offer a cake from the first of your ground-up meal as an offering from your threshing floor—so you are to lift it up.

21.verse: Throughout your generations to come, you are to give this offering from the first of your ground-up meal.

22.verse: Unintentional Versus Defiant Sin - “If you unintentionally fail, not keeping any of these mitzvot that ADONAI related to Moses

23.verse: —that is, anything that ADONAI commanded you through Moses’s hand, from the day ADONAI commanded and onward throughout your generations—

24.verse: and it is done unintentionally out of sight of the community, then the entire community is to offer one young bull from the herd for a burnt offering as a pleasing aroma to ADONAI, along with its appropriate grain offering and drink offering, and one male goat as a sin offering.

25.verse: So the kohen will make atonement for the entire community of Bnei-Yisrael, and they will be forgiven, for it was unintentional and they brought a fire offering and their sin offering to ADONAI for their error.

26.verse: So the whole community of Bnei-Yisrael along with the outsider residing among them will be forgiven, for all the people were involved in unintentional wrongdoing.

27.verse: “If but one person should sin unintentionally, he is to bring a year-old female goat for a sin offering.

28.verse: The kohen is to make atonement before ADONAI for that person who erred by sinning without intent, and he is to be forgiven when atonement has been made for him.

29.verse: Whether a native-born of Bnei-Yisrael or an outsider living among them, one Torah applies to you for the one sinning unintentionally.

30.verse: “But the person who sins defiantly, whether native or outsider, reviles ADONAI and that person is to be cut off from his people.

31.verse: Because he has despised the word of ADONAI and has broken His commandment, that person will certainly be cut off—his guilt will remain on him.”

32.verse: While Bnei-Yisrael were in the wilderness, they found a man gathering wood on the Shabbat.

33.verse: Those who found him gathering wood brought him to Moses, Aaron and the entire assembly.

34.verse: They kept him under arrest, not being clear what was to be done to him.

35.verse: ADONAI said to Moses, “The man has to die. The whole assembly is to stone him with stones outside the camp.”

36.verse: So the whole assembly took him outside the camp. They stoned him with stones. He died just as ADONAI commanded Moses.

37.verse: Tzitzit for Holiness - ADONAI spoke to Moses saying,

38.verse: “Speak to Bnei-Yisrael. Say to them that they are to make for themselves tzitzit on the corners of their garments throughout their generations, and they are to put a blue cord on each tzitzit.

39.verse: It will be your own tzitzit—so whenever you look at them, you will remember all the mitzvot of ADONAI and do them and not go spying out after your own hearts and your own eyes, prostituting yourselves.

40.verse: This way you will remember and obey all My mitzvot and you will be holy to your God.

41.verse: I am ADONAI your God. I brought you out of the land of Egypt to be your God. I am ADONAI your God.”

1.verse: Parashat Korach Rebellion of Korah - Now Korah, son of Izhar son of Kohath son of Levi, and sons of Reuben—Dathan and Abiram, sons of Eliab, and On son of Peleth—

2.verse: rose up against Moses and took 250 men from Bnei-Yisrael, men of renown who had been appointed to the council.

3.verse: They assembled against Moses and Aaron. They said to them, “You’ve gone too far! All the community is holy—all of them—and ADONAI is with them! Then why do you exalt yourselves above the assembly of ADONAI?”

4.verse: When Moses heard this, he fell on his face.

5.verse: Then he said to Korah and all his following saying, “In the morning ADONAI will reveal who is His and who is holy. The one whom He will let come near to Him will be the one He chooses to come near to Him.

6.verse: Do this, Korah and your whole following! Take for yourselves censers.

7.verse: Put fire and incense into them in the presence of ADONAI. Tomorrow the man that ADONAI chooses will be the holy one! You sons of Levi are the ones who have gone too far!”

8.verse: Moses also said to Korah, “Listen now, sons of Levi!

9.verse: Isn’t it enough that the God of Israel has set you apart from the community of Israel to bring you near to Him to do the work of the Tabernacle of ADONAI and to stand before the community to minister to them?

10.verse: So He brought you close, along with all your fellow sons of Levi. But you are seeking the priesthood, too!

11.verse: Therefore you and all your following are banding together against ADONAI! Who then is Aaron—that you are grumbling against him?”

12.verse: Then Moses sent word to call Dathan and Abiram, sons of Eliab. But they said, “We will not come!

13.verse: Isn’t it enough that you brought us from a land flowing with milk and honey, only to kill us in the wilderness? And now you would lord it over us?

14.verse: What’s more, you haven’t brought us into a land flowing with milk and honey, nor given us an inheritance of fields and vineyards. Would you now gouge out the eyes of those men? We won’t come!”

15.verse: Then Moses became very angry and said to ADONAI, “Do not accept their offering. I haven’t taken from them a single donkey, nor have I wronged one of them!”

16.verse: So Moses said to Korah, “You and your whole following are to appear before ADONAI—you, they and Aaron—tomorrow!

17.verse: Each man will take his censer and you are to put incense into them—250 censers total. You are to present it before ADONAI, you and Aaron each presenting his censer.”

18.verse: So each man took his censer, put fire and incense into it, and stood with Moses and Aaron at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

19.verse: When Korah and all his following had assembled in opposition to them at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting, then the glory of ADONAI appeared to the entire assembly.

20.verse: Then ADONAI spoke to Moses and Aaron saying,

21.verse: “Separate yourselves from among this assembly, so that I may consume them at once!”
